text:
[Lanka is laid siege by the Vanara army. Ravana beholds the army of vanaras from the top of his palace. Rama and Lakshman take position of the Northern gate of Lanka. Ravana mobilizes his army and severe conflict takes place between Rakshasas and Vanara army.]

ततस्तेराक्षसास्तत्रगत्वारावणमन्दिरम् ।

न्यवेदयन्पुरींरुद्धांरामेणसहवानरैः ।।6.42.1।।
meaning: तत then, राक्षसा Rakshasas, स्तत्र there, रावणमन्दिरम् Ravana's abode, गत्वा proceeding to, रामेण Rama's, वानरैः Vanaras, सह along with, रुद्धां occupied, न्यवेदय informed, न्पुरीं total city.
translation: Then the Rakshasas proceeding to Ravana's abode informed that Rama along with the vanaras have occupied the whole of Lanka.

meaning: रुद्धां occupied, तु also, नगरीं city, श्रुत्वा hearing, जातक्रोधो very furious, निशाचरः night ranger, विधानं knowing, द्विगुणं twice, श्रुत्वा hearing, प्रासादं top of the mansion, अध्यरोहत planning for the protection of Lanka.
translation: On knowing that Lanka is occupied, the night ranger Ravana, became very furious and doubled the forces of Lanka for the protection and went to the top of Lanka palace.

meaning: स: he, युद्धकाङ्क्षिभिः desirous of combat, असङ्ख्येयै countless numbers, हर्रिगणैः troops of Vanaras, सशैलवनकाननाम् mountains and forests, सर्वतो all over, अवृतां occupied, लङ्कां Lanka, ददर्शा observed.
translation: He observed a countless number of Vanara troops spread all over Lanka, mountains, and forests.

meaning: स: he, वानरैः Vanaras, सर्वां all, वसुधां earth, कवलीकृताम् occupied, दृष्ट्वा seeing, कथं how, स्युरिति thought, क्षपयितव्याः to destroy, चिन्तापरो thinking, अभवत् started.
translation: Seeing the Vanaras occupying the entire earth, Ravana thought of destroying and started thinking.

meaning: स: he, रावणः Ravana, सुचिरं for long, चिन्तयित्वा thinking over, धैर्यमालम्ब्य picking up courage, अयतलोचनः with thoughtful eyes, राघवं Raghava, हरियूथांश्च at the Vanaras, ददर्शा saw.
translation: Ravana, thinking over for long, picking up courage, saw Rama's Vanaras with thoughtful eyes.

meaning: राघवः Raghava, मुदितो happily, सहसैन्येन with army, पुप्लुवे near, लङ्कां Lanka, सर्वतो all over, राक्षसैर्वृताम् fully filled with Rakshasas, गुप्तांवै protected, लङ्कां Lanka, ददर्श witnessed.
translation: Raghava accompanied by the army happily went near and witnessed Lanka filled with Rakshasas all over.

meaning: दाशरथि son of Dasaratha, चित्रध्वजपताकिनीम् decorated with flags and posts, लङ्कां Lanka, चेतसा thinking, सीतां of Sita, दूयमानेन worried, सहसा very much, जगाम remained.
translation: The son of Dasaratha saw Lanka decorated with flags and posts and thinking of Sita he became very worried.

meaning: अत्र here, सा she, मृगशावाक्षी dove eyed, जनकात्मजा Janaka's daughter, पीड्यते tormented, मत्कृते because of me, शोकसन्तप्ता immersed in sorrow, कृशा emaciated, स्थण्डिलशायिनी without food struggling.
translation: "Here (Lanka) is the daughter of Janaka, immersed in sorrow because of me, tormented and emaciated without food and struggling."

meaning: धर्मात्मा righteous, स: he (Rama), पीड्यमानां pained, वैदेहीम Vaidehi, अचिन्तयन् thinking of very much, क्षिप्रमाज्ञापयामास immediately ordered, वानरान् Vanaras, द्विषतां enemies, वधे to kill.
translation: Thinking of Vaidehi again and again, who is pained, Rama ordered the Vanaras to kill the enemies immediately.

meaning: क्लिष्टकर्मणा one who does not cause sorrow, एवमुक्ते having ordered that way तु, वचने his words, प्लवगाः monkeys, संघर्षमाणाः getting ready for war, सिम्हनादैरनादयन् roared like a lion
translation: Ordered in that way by Rama, who does not cause sorrow, the monkeys roared like lions getting ready for war on hearing Rama's words.

meaning: हरियूथपाः Vanara troops, लङ्कां Lanka, शिखरैर्विकिरामैनां with mountain peaks, मुष्टिभिरेववा or with fists, इति this, स्मदधिरे will crush, सर्वे all, मनांसि thought.
translation: The monkey troops thought of crushing Lanka with their fists and mountain peaks.

meaning: हरियूथपाः Vanara leaders, गिरिशृङ्गाणि mountains, शिखराणि peaks, तरूंश्चोत्पाट्य holding trees, महान्तिच huge, विविधां many kinds, स्तिष्ठन्ति ready to fight.
translation: Holding the mountain peaks, huge trees of many kinds, the Vanara leaders stood ready to fight.

meaning: राक्षसेन्द्रस्य king of Rakshasas, प्रेक्षतो as he was looking, तान्यनीकानि all the Vanara army, राघवप्रियकामार्थं to make Rama happy, भागशः in divisions, लङ्काम Lanka, आरुरुहुस्तदा ascended the boundary.
translation: To make Rama happy, all the Vanara army divided into groups and started ascending the boundary (of Lanka) walls the king of Rakshasas was witnessing.

meaning: ताम्रवक्त्रा having copper colour faces, हेमाभा golden coloured, रामार्थे for the sake of Rama, त्यक्तजीविताः giving up life, सालतालशिलायुधाः Sala, Tala trees and rocks as weapons, लङ्कामेवाभ्यवर्तन्त went to Lanka.
translation: Vanaras of copper colour faces and golden coloured ones, dedicating their lives for the sake of Rama holding Sala trees and rocks went towards Lanka.

meaning: ते they (Vanaras ), द्रुमैः trees, पर्वताग्रैश्च peaks of mountains, मुष्टिभिश्च even with fists, प्लवङ्गमाः monkeys, प्राकाराग्रा top of boundary, अरण्यानि forests, ममन्थुस्तोरणानिच gateways of the city
translation: With the means of mountain peaks, as well as their fists, the Vanaras scaled the boundary walls and gateways of the city.

meaning: वानराः Vanaras, पारिखाः with soil, पर्वताग्रैश्च with mountain peaks, तृणैः with grass, काष्ठैश्च wooden pieces, पांसुभिः moats also, प्रसन्नसलिलायुताः with pure water, पूरयन्ति filled.
translation: The Vanaras started filling the moats with soil, pure water, logs of wood, grass, and mountain peaks.

meaning: ततः then, वानराः Vanaras, सहस्रयूथाश्च thousand, कोटीयूथाश्च one crore, कोटीशतयुताश्चान्ये hundred crores, लङ्काम into Lanka, आरुरुहुस्तदा ascended then.
translation: Then the Vanaras in thousands and crores ascended Lanka.

meaning: काञ्चनानि golden, प्रमृद्नन्तस्तोरणानि breaking the gateways, कैलासशिखराभानि like the peaks of Kailasa mountain, गोपुराणि towers, प्रमथ्यच crushing, प्लवङ्गमाः monkeys went.
translation: The Vanaras started breaking the golden gateways and crushing them which were like peaks of Kailasa mountain.

meaning: आप्लवन्तः jumping here and there, महावारणसंनिभाः like huge elephants, प्लवन्तश्च Vanaras, गर्जन्तश्च roaring like lion, लङ्कांतामभिधावन्ति went up to Lanka.
translation: Jumping here and there like huge elephants, the Vanaras roaring like lions went into Lanka.

meaning: जयत्य victorious, अतिबलो exceedingly strong, रामो Rama, महाबलः endowed with supreme, strength, लक्ष्मणश्च Lakshmana also, राजा king, जयति victorious, सुग्रीवो Sugriva, राघवेण by Raghava, अभिपालितः protected by on all sides.
translation: "Victorious is Sri Rama, who is exceedingly strong and Lakshmana who is endowed with supreme strength. Victorious is Sugriva the king of Vanaras who is protected by Raghava on all sides."

meaning: कामरूपिणः who could change their form at will, इत्येवं in this manner, घोषयन्तश्च shouting, गर्जन्तश्च roaring, लङ्कायाः into Lanka, प्राकारं defensive walls, अभ्यधावन्त rushed over.
translation: Shouting in that manner, the monkeys who could change their form at their will started roaring and rushed towards the defensive walls.

meaning: वीरबाहुः Veerabahu, सुबाहुश्च and Subahu, नल Nala, वनगोचरः foremost of monkeys, निपीड्योप storming, निविष्टास्ते defensive, प्राकारं boundary walls, हरियूथपाः Vanara leaders, एतस्मिन्नन्तरे in the meantime inside, चक्रुः went, स्कन्धावारनिवेशनम् remained stationed at northeast.
translation: Veerabahu, Subahu, Nala and the foremost of the Vanara leaders storming the boundary walls in the meantime went inside and stationed at the northeast gate.

meaning: कुमुदः Kumuda, तु also, कोटीभि one crore, र्दशभि ten, आर्वृतः surrounded by, पूर्वद्वारं east gate, आवृत्य surrounded, बलवां mighty, स्तस्थौ remained, हरिभि monkeys also, र्जितकाशिभिः appearing victorious.
translation: Kumuda, surrounded by ten crores of mighty monkeys, who appeared like conquerors, stationed at the east gate.

meaning: प्रघसो Praghasa, हरिः monkey, महाबाहु broad shouldered, पनसश्च Panasa also, वानर Vanaras, साहाय्यार्थं for assisting, तस्यैव himself, निविष्टः encamped, बहुभि many, आर्वृतः surrounded.
translation: Praghasa the broad shouldered Vanara, was surrounded by Panasa for assisting him who encamped surrounded by many.

meaning: वीरः valiant, शतबलिः Satabali, कपिः monkey, विंशत्या twenty, कोटिभि crores, आवृत्य surrounded by, बलवांस्तस्थौ stood besieging, दक्षिणं south, द्वारमागम्य reached the gate.
translation: Valiant Satabali with twenty crores of monkeys stood besieging the south gate.

meaning: गतस्तारापिता father of Tara (wife of Vali), बलवांस्तस्थौ the mighty, सुषेणः Sushena, आवृत्य along with, षष्टिकोटिभिरावृतः sixty crores of monkeys surrounding, पश्चिमद्वारं at the western gate.
translation: Sushena, father of Tara, (Vali's wife) the mighty, stood with sixty crores of monkeys at the western gate.

meaning: उत्तरंद्वारमासाद्य reaching north gate, रामः Rama, सौमित्रिणा Saumithri, सह along with, आवृत्य accompanied by, बलवांस्तस्थौ blockading the gate, हरीश्वरः Lord of monkeys, सुग्रीवश्च Sugriva.
translation: Reaching the north gate, Sri Rama along with Saumithri, blockading the gate stood Sugriva the Lord of monkeys.

meaning: महाकायो of gigantic body, गवाक्षो Gavaksha, भीमदर्शनः of fierce appearance, गोलाङ्गूलो Golangula species of monkeys, कोट्या crore, वृतः surrounded by, महावीर्यस्तस्थौ of extraordinary virility, रामस्य Rama's, पार्श्वतः by the side of.
translation: Gavaksha of gigantic body and fierce appearance, along with one crore of Golangula species of monkeys endowed with extraordinary virility stood by the side of Sri Rama.

meaning: वृतः accompanied by, कोट्या one crore, ऋक्षाणां bears, भीमवेगानां of redoubtable fury, धूम्रः Dhumra (brother of Jambavan), शत्रुनिबर्हणः exterminator of his foes, महावीर्यस्तस्थौ endowed with extraordinary valour, रामस्य Rama's, पार्श्वतः by the side of.
translation: Accompanied by a crore of Bears of redoubtable fury, Dhumra (brother of Jambavan), an exterminator of foes endowed with extraordinary valour stood by Rama's side.

meaning: वृतो accompanied by, सन्नद्धस्तु defensive clamour, महावीर्यो of extraordinary virility, गदापाणि wielding mace, विर्भीषणः Vibheeshana, यस्तैस्तु stood, सचिवैस्तस्थौ with ministers stood, तत्र there, महाबलः mighty.
translation: Vibheeshana with defensive clamour, of extraordinary virility accompanied by his mighty ministers, stood there with his mace in hand.

meaning: गजो Gaja, गवाक्षो Gavaksha, गवयः Gava, शरभ Sarabha, गन्धमादनः Gandamadhana, मन्तात्परिधावन्तो all over wandering, ररक्षु protecting, हर्रिवाहिनीम् monkey troops.
translation: Gaja, Gavaksha, Gava, Sarabha, Gandhamadana stood protecting the monkey troops wandering all over.

meaning: ततः thereafter, राक्षसेश्वरः Lord of Rakshasas, रावण Ravana, सर्वसैन्यानां all his forces, निर्याणं to depart, कोपपरीतात्मा overcome by fury, द्रुत to advance, आज्ञापयत्तदा ordered.
translation: Thereafter Ravana, the Lord of Rakshasas overcome by fury ordered all his forces to advance.

meaning: रावणस्य from Ravana's, मुखोद्गतम् command issued from his mouth, एतच्छ्रुत्वा as soon as it was heard, ततो that, वाक्यं words. सहसा instantly, भीमनिर्घोषमुद्घुष्टं terrific roar, रजनीचरैः night rangers.
translation: Hearing the command issued from Ravana's mouth, immediately a terrific roar was raised by the night rangers.

meaning: ततः then, प्रचोदिता shone, भेर्यश्चन्द्र like the moon, पाण्डरपुष्कराः white discs, भीमा terrific, राक्षसानां Rakshasas, हेमकोणाहता gold sticks.
translation: Then shone the white discs like the moon beaten by the Rakshasas with gold sticks making terrific sound.

meaning: राक्षसानां Rakshasas, सुघोराणां terrific sounds, शतसहस्रशः hundred thousand, महाघोषाः loud noise, शङ्खाः with conchs, विनेदुश्च sonorous, मुखमारुत with wind from their mouth, पूरिताः blown.
translation: With hundred thousand Rakshasas blowing sonorous conchs, with the wind from their mouths, terrific noise arose.

meaning: ते they, बभुः brilliant, शुभनीलाङ्गाः dark limbs, रजनीचराः night rangers, सशङ्खा with conches, इवाम्बुदाः like clouds, विद्युन्मण्डलसन्नद्धाः provided with armour with flashes of lightning, सबलाका accompanied by herons.
translation: The night rangers with their brilliant dark limbs, with conchs, were like dark clouds provided with armour with flashes of lightning and accompanied by herons.

meaning: रावणचोदिताः urged by Ravana, सैन्या army, ततः then, हृष्टा joyfully, निष्पतन्ति rushed forth, वेगा swiftly, महोदधेः great ocean, इव like, समये at the time of, पूर्यमाणस्य universal destruction.
translation: Urged by Ravana, the army then joyfully rushed forth swiftly like a great ocean at the time of universal destruction.

meaning: ततो thereafter, वानरसैन्येन by the Vanara army, मुक्तो emitted, नादः sound, समन्ततः on all sides, पूरितो filled, मलयः Malaya mountain, येन by that, स that, सानुप्रस्थकन्दरः major and minor peaks and caves.
translation: Thereafter the Vanara army emitted a sound that filled all sides of Malaya Mountain, its major and minor caves.

meaning: शङ्खदुन्दुभिसंघुष्टः blast of conchs and roll of drums, सिम्हनाद roar of lions, स्तरस्विनाम् and of Vanara and Rakshasa heroes, पृथिवीं earth, चान्तरिक्षंच to sky, सागरंचैव up to ocean, नादयन् resounded.
translation: By the blast of conchs and roll of drums, and roar of lions of Vanara and Rakshasa forces it resounded all over the earth, sky and up to the ocean.

meaning: गजानां of elephants, बृंहितैः trumpeting, सार्धंहयानां neighing of horses, हेषितैरपि clatter of wheels, रथानां of chariots, नेमिघोषैश्च shout of, रक्षसाम्, Rakshasas, वदनस्वनः resounded in the air.
translation: The trumpeting of the elephants, the neighing of horses, the clatter of the wheels of the chariots and the shout of Rakshasas resounded in the air.

meaning: एतस्मिन्नन्तरे in the meantime, घोरः dreadful, सङ्ग्रामः conflict, समवर्तत all over, रक्षसां Rakshasas, वानराणांच between Vanaras, यथादेवासुरे like the conflict between Devas and asuras, पुरा earlier.
translation: In the meantime, dreadful conflict arose all over between Rakshasas and Vanaras, which was like the conflict between Devas and asuras earlier.

meaning: ते the Rakshasas, स्वविक्रमान् vaunting their own prowess, गदाभिः with maces, प्रदीप्ताभिः flaming शक्तिशूलपरश्वधैः with javelins, tridents and pikes, निजघ्नु fiercely struck, नरान्घोराः at Vanaras, कथयन्तः attacked.
translation: Vowing their own prowess, the Rakshasas began to strike the Vanaras with maces, flaming javelins, tridents, and pikes fiercely.

meaning: राजा king, जयति victory, सुग्रीव Sugriva, इति thus, शब्दो sound, महानभूत् be triumphant, राजन् king, जय victorious, जयेत्युक्त्वा saying victory to you, स्वस्वनामकथान्ततः arose war cry from the Vanaras.
translation: "May the vanara king,triumphant Sugriva be victorious", thus sounded the cry of vanaras in the battlefield.

meaning: तथा in the same manner, वृक्षैर्महाकायाः with trees, पर्वताग्रैश्च with mountain peaks, वानराः Vanaras, रक्षांसि at Rakshasas, नखैर्दन्तैश्च with nails and teeth, निजघ्नुस्तानि attacked, वेगिताः swiftly.
translation: Vanaras in the same manner attacked the Rakshasas, with trees and mountains, swiftly and with their nails and teeth.

meaning: राक्षसास्त्वपरे redoubtable Rakshasas, प्राकारस्था standing on the walls, भीमाः dreadful, भिन्दिपालैश्च Bhindipalas (javelin like weapons), खड्गैश्च and swords, शूलैश्चैव with tridents, व्यदारयन् pierced.
translation: Standing on the walls, the redoubtable Rakshasas, pierced the Vanaras with swords, dreadful Bhindipalas.

meaning: प्राकारस्थान्महीगताः stationed on the boundary walls, वानराश्चापि Vanaras also, राक्षसान्पातयामासुः dragged down the Rakshasas, प्लवङ्गमाः monkeys, समाप्लुत्य jumping up.
translation: The vanaras jumping up dragged the Rakshasas stationed on the boundary wall down to the ground.

meaning: स that, सम्प्रहार conflict, रक्षसां of Rakshasas, वानराणांच and Vanaras, तमुलो intense, मांस flesh, शोणित blood, कर्दमः like mire, सम्बभूवा that happened, अद्भुतोपमाः was amazing.
translation:
The conflict that happened between the Rakshasas and Vanaras was amazing and intense and left a mire of flesh and blood.
।। इत्यार्षेश्रीमद्वाल्मीकिरामायणेआदिकाव्येयुद्धकाण्डेद्विचत्वारिंशस्सर्गः ।।
This is the end of the forty second sarga of Yuddha Kanda of the first epic the holy Ramayana composed by sage Valmiki.
